newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end lower as tankan effect fizzles.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end lower as tankan effect fizzles.

text.p: Tokyo stocks closed slightly lower on Thursday as an upbeat mood carried over from the previous day finally fizzled out.
The market had been buoyed by the Bank of Japan's key "tankan" survey on Wednesday, which revealed surprisingly strong sentiment among big manufacturers.

The 225-share Nikkei average closed down 54.51 points or 0.26 percent at 20,624.76. The index hit a new 1997 intra-day high of 20,910.79 soon after the opening but it fell short of the key 21,000 threshold.
Its September futures finished 60 points lower at 20,700.

"The tankan survey stimulated domestic institutional investors' appetite. But today the buying was limited to banks, brokerages and insurers, so it failed to keep on propping up the Nikkei 225," said Kenji Karikomi, deputy general manager at manager at Daiwa Securities Co Ltd.
